SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column

Class ColumnRepresentation

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column.ColumnRepresentation
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultRepresentation, EmptyRepresentation, ResourceRepresentation, UnsupportedRepresentation
public abstract class ColumnRepresentation extends Object
Describes the representation of a Collection within a Dataset.

Also provides operations for transforming and manipulating the representation.

Author:
Piotr Szul, John Grimes

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    DEF_NOT_SINGULAR_ERROR
    Error message used when expecting a singular collection but finding multiple elements.

    • getAt

      @Nonnull public static Column getAt(@Nonnull Column arrayColumn, int index)
      Wrapper on the Spark SQL functions object to allow easier access to functions in Java.
      Parameters:
      arrayColumn - the array column
      index - the index
      Returns:
      the column at the specified index

    • binaryOperator

      @Nonnull public static ColumnRepresentation binaryOperator(@Nonnull ColumnRepresentation left, @Nonnull ColumnRepresentation right, @Nonnull BinaryOperator<Column> operator)
      Create a new ColumnRepresentation from the result of a function that takes two Column operands and returns a single Column result.
      Parameters:
      left - The left operand
      right - The right operand
      operator - The function to apply to the operands
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation representing the result of the function

    • call

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation call(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> function)
      Create a new ColumnRepresentation from the result of a function that takes the column of this representation and returns a new Column.
      Parameters:
      function - The function to apply to the column
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation containing the result of the function

    • getValue

      @Nonnull public abstract Column getValue()
      Get the underlying Column that this representation is based on.
      Returns:
      The underlying Column

    • copyOf

      @Nonnull public abstract ColumnRepresentation copyOf(@Nonnull Column newValue)
      Create a new ColumnRepresentation from a new Column.

      This method preserves the representation type - a ResourceRepresentation will return a new ResourceRepresentation, and a DefaultRepresentation will return a new DefaultRepresentation. This is important for maintaining correct behavior when transforming columns in different schema contexts.

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new Column to represent
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation representing the new column

    • map

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation map(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> lambda)
      Maps the current ColumnRepresentation using a lambda function.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The lambda function to apply to the column
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation containing the result of the function

    • vectorize

      @Nonnull public abstract ColumnRepresentation vectorize(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> arrayExpression, @Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> singularExpression)
      Create a new ColumnRepresentation by providing two functions: one that takes an array and one that takes a singular value. The array function is applied to the column if it is an array, and the singular function is applied to the column if it is not an array.
      Parameters:
      arrayExpression - The function to apply to the column if it is an array
      singularExpression - The function to apply to the column if it is not an array
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation representing the result of the function

    • flatten

      @Nonnull public abstract ColumnRepresentation flatten()
      Flattens the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is flattened

    • traverse

      @Nonnull public abstract ColumnRepresentation traverse(@Nonnull String fieldName)
      Returns a new ColumnRepresentation that represents the result of traversing to a nested field within the current representation. The result is flattened.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field to traverse to
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation representing the result of the traversal

    • traverse

      @Nonnull public abstract ColumnRepresentation traverse(@Nonnull String fieldName, @Nonnull Optional<Enumerations.FHIRDefinedType> fhirType)
      Returns a new ColumnRepresentation that represents the result of traversing to a nested field within the current representation. This method also takes the FHIR type of the field into account to return a more specific representation.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field to traverse to
      fhirType - The FHIR type of the field
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation representing the result of the traversal

    • getField

      @Nonnull public abstract ColumnRepresentation getField(@Nonnull String fieldName)
      Returns a new ColumnRepresentation that represents the result of traversing to a nested field within the current representation. The results can be nested.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field to traverse to
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation representing the result of the traversal

    • asStringValue

      public Optional<String> asStringValue()
      Converts the current ColumnRepresentation to a string value.
      Returns:
      An optional string value of the current ColumnRepresentation

    • toArray

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation toArray()
      Converts the current ColumnRepresentation to an array.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is an array

    • orElse

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation orElse(@Nonnull Object value)
      Returns the current ColumnRepresentation or a literal value if the current one is null.
      Parameters:
      value - The literal value to return if the current ColumnRepresentation is null
      Returns:
      The current ColumnRepresentation or the literal value if the current one is null

    • singular

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation singular()
      Returns a singular value from the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is a singular value

    • singular

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation singular(@Nullable String errorMessage)
      Returns a singular value from the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - the error message to use when the representation cannot be singularized.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is a singular value

    • ensureSingular

      @Nonnull public Column ensureSingular()
      Creates a Column expression that enforces the singularity constraint. This should be called when a singular value is required but will not be directly used, to ensure the constraint is checked during evaluation.

      The returned Column evaluates to null if the constraint is satisfied, or raises an error if the collection has multiple elements.

      Returns:
      A Column that enforces singularity and evaluates to null

    • plural

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation plural()
      Converts the current ColumnRepresentation a plural representation. The values are represented as arrays where an empty collection is represented as an empty array. This is different from the toArray() method which represents an empty collection as null.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is an array

    • applyTo

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation applyTo(@Nonnull Column mapColumn)
      Applies a mapping column to this column representation.
      Parameters:
      mapColumn - the mapping column to apply
      Returns:
      a new ColumnRepresentation with the mapping applied

    • filter

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation filter(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Column> lambda)
      Filters the current ColumnRepresentation using a lambda function.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The lambda function to use for filtering
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is filtered

    • negate

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation negate()
      Inverts the current ColumnRepresentation (applies unary minus).
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is inverted

    • like

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation like(@Nonnull String regex)
      Checks if the current ColumnRepresentation matches a regular expression.
      Parameters:
      regex - The regular expression to match against
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the match

    • removeNulls

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation removeNulls()
      Removes nulls from the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that has no nulls

    • normaliseNull

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation normaliseNull()
      Converts empty arrays to nulls in the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation when all empty collections are represented as NULLs regardless of their arity.

    • asCanonical

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation asCanonical()
      Converts the current ColumnRepresentation to a canonical form.
      Returns:
      a canonical form of this column representation

    • transform

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation transform(UnaryOperator<Column> lambda)
      Transforms the current ColumnRepresentation in a way that only affects a singular value if it is not null.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The lambda function to use for transformation
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is transformed

    • aggregate

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation aggregate(@Nonnull Object zeroValue, BinaryOperator<Column> aggregator)

      Parameters:
      zeroValue - The zero value to use for aggregation
      aggregator - The aggregator function to use for aggregation
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is aggregated

      Returns the last value from the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Returns:

      Counts the values in the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the count of values

    • isEmpty

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation isEmpty()
      Checks if the current ColumnRepresentation is empty.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the check

    • toBoolean

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation toBoolean()
      Gets the boolean value of the current ColumnRepresentation. Returns `true` for non-empty representations or `null` otherwise. This is NOT a simple type cast!
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation with the boolean representation.

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation join(@Nonnull ColumnRepresentation separator)
      Joins the current ColumnRepresentation with a separator.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • transformWithUdf

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation transformWithUdf(@Nonnull String udfName, @Nonnull ColumnRepresentation... args)
      Calls a UDF with the current ColumnRepresentation and other arguments, and uses the result to transform the current ColumnRepresentation.
      Parameters:
      udfName - The name of the UDF to call
      args - The arguments to pass to the UDF
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the UDF call

    • callUdf

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation callUdf(@Nonnull String udfName, @Nonnull ColumnRepresentation... args)
      Calls a UDF with the current ColumnRepresentation and other arguments, and returns the result as a new ColumnRepresentation.
      Parameters:
      udfName - The name of the UDF to call
      args - The arguments to pass to the UDF
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the UDF call

    • elementCast

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation elementCast(@Nonnull DataType dataType)
      Casts (elementwise) the current ColumnRepresentation to a different data type.
      Parameters:
      dataType - The data type to cast to
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the cast

    • asString

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation asString()
      Casts the current ColumnRepresentation to a string.
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the cast

    • contains

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation contains(@Nonnull ColumnRepresentation element, @Nonnull BinaryOperator<Column> comparator)
      Checks if the current ColumnRepresentation contains to another one using a specified comparator. If the tested element is NULL the result is also NULL. If the tested collection is NULL the result is false.
      Parameters:
      element - The element to check for
      comparator - The comparator to use
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the check

    • traverseChoice

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation traverseChoice(@Nonnull ElementDefinition... definitions)
      Traverses the current ColumnRepresentation to a selected elements in a choice and returns a new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the traversal.
      Parameters:
      definitions - The definitions to traverse to
      Returns:
      A new ColumnRepresentation that is the result of the traversal
